section.heading: Initiation by Office of the Attorney General of support proceeding under Convention.

para.text: In a support proceeding under this subchapter, the Office of the Attorney General shall:
Initiate or facilitate the institution of a proceeding regarding an application in a tribunal of the District.
The following support proceedings are available to an obligee under the Convention:
Recognition or recognition and enforcement of a foreign support order;
Enforcement of a support order issued or recognized in the District;
Establishment of a support order if there is no existing order, including, if necessary, determination of parentage of a child;
Establishment of a support order if recognition of a foreign support order is refused under ยง 46-357.08(b)(2), (4), or (9);
Modification of a support order of a tribunal of the District; and
Modification of a support order of a tribunal of another state or a foreign country.
The following support proceedings are available under the Convention to an obligor against which there is an existing support order:
Recognition of an order suspending or limiting enforcement of an existing support order of a tribunal of the District;
Modification of a support order of a tribunal of the District; and
Modification of a support order of a tribunal of another state or a foreign country.
A tribunal of the District may not require security, bond, or deposit, however described, to guarantee the payment of costs and expenses in proceedings under the Convention.
